ngiemboon: «Ŋweʼe menò mɔɔn, ńtúm ńnáa mbwó Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à líe cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto gie áa tÿǒsoŋo Saandɛ́sè. Ŋweʼe ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin Mezẅìge Ssé sɔɔnmbʉ́a mbɔɔ mecÿɔ́ʼsaŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a la, à ne ńgɔɔn ngie: N ne ńzsé mefàʼ mí, ńne ńzsé ngie mé gwaa gɔɔn ngie pi ee ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, mbà pi léen ńkwé.
en: “Write to the angel    of the church in Sardis: Thus says the one who has the seven spirits of God   # 3:1 Rv 1:4; 4:5; 5:6 and the seven stars:   # 3:1 Rv 1:16,20; 2:1 I know your works;   # 3:1 Rv 2:2,19; 3:8,15 you have a reputation   # 3:1 Or have a name for being alive, but you are dead.   # 3:1 Rm 6:11

ngiemboon: Pi zyeen, ńgwoon yɛ̂ pfwɔ̀ʼ gie á ne ńge mege kwé lɛ̂, ńkúʼte. N gɔɔn nue n gyǎ mefàʼ mí gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, tsoon tàʼ mǒ te nyé té gẅiin lɔ̌ʼ wɔ́.
en: Be alert    and strengthen   # 3:2 Other mss read guard what remains, which is about to die,   # 3:2 Or strengthen who remain, who are about to die for I have not found your works complete before my God.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi ké ńkímte mmó gie mé la zíʼi gẅí, ńgíŋ ńkímte ntí gie pi la lɔg ńjúʼ. Pi kúʼte yɛ̌ mmó, ńkúbe mà gẅi. Pi lɔɔn ńnyé ńdyé lyě, mbà n ge vege vege tó páʼ ntsǒŋ la, tà pi é le zsé fʉ̀ʼ gie n tǒ wɔ́.
en: Remember, then, what you have received and heard; keep it, and repent. If you are not alert, I will come    like a thief, and you have no idea at what hour I will come upon you.   # 3:3 Mt 24:42–44; Mk 13:32–37; Lk 12:35–40; 1Th 5:1–11; Rv 16:15

ngiemboon: N kě ńgɔɔn páʼɔɔn, etsɔ́ ntáʼ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi á tÿǒsoŋo Saandɛ́sè, mbà pɔ́ kaa lɔg ncÿǒ ńzɔ́ʼ menzsǒ mɔ́b wɔ́. Pɔ́ ge gÿo maʼ mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ, peg lâ pɔ̌ pú ńteme kwò ńgiŋ, mélàʼmie pɔ́ kǔʼ páʼ ngwɔ́ peg lâ pɔ̌ giŋ.
en: But you have a few people    in Sardis who have not defiled   # 3:4 Or soiled their clothes,   # 3:4 Zch 3:3–4; 2Co 7:1; Rv 14:4 and they will walk with me in white, because they are worthy.

ngiemboon: Áa páʼ nyìŋ gẅie à ge láʼ lÿɔ́ʼ ncù tà cʉa nò tepòŋ ge láʼ maʼ mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ púʼu. M biŋ le láʼ ńzáʼ lezíŋ sé tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne legwɔ́ wó wɔ́. N gÿo ńtyé mvfò Tá wɔ̀ɔn pâ mecÿɔ́ʼ pé, ńgɔɔn ngie aa wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ.
en: “In the same way, the one who conquers    will be dressed in white clothes,   # 3:5 Mt 17:2; Rv 3:18; 4:4 and I will never erase his name from the book of life   # 3:5 Ex 32:32–33; Ps 69:28; Dn 12:1; Rv 13:8; 17:8; 20:12,15; 21:27 but will acknowledge his name before my Father and before his angels.   # 3:5 Mt 10:32; Lk 12:8

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó, lélɔg ńjúʼu nò, á júʼu nò gie Zẅìge Ssé ne ńgɔɔn mbwó mecúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto lɔɔn!»
en: “Let anyone who has ears to hear listen    to what the Spirit says   # 3:6 Ac 8:29; 10:19; 11:12; 13:2; 21:11; 28:25; 1Tm 4:1; Heb 3:7; 10:15; Rv 14:13; 22:17 to the churches.

ngiemboon: «Ŋweʼe menò mɔɔn, ńtúm ńnáa mbwó cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à líe cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto gie áa tÿǒsoŋo Filandelefia. Ŋweʼe ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ńgwɔ́ shwòŋo nò nénʉ́, á yé gẅie à gẅiin kí fùɔ Ndavîd, á yé gẅie à tsɔ́ʼ ncwò ndá, nyìŋ te kuʼu léjÿɔ́ʼ wɔ́, ńjÿɔ́ʼ, nyìŋ te kuʼu létsɔ́ʼ wɔ́, à ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: “Write to the angel of the church in Philadelphia: Thus says the Holy One, the true one,    the one who has the key of David, who opens and no one will close, and who closes and no one opens:   # 3:7 Is 22:22; Mt 16:19

ngiemboon: N ne ńzsé mefàʼ mí, ńne ńzsé ngie pi te mbòŋ metʉ̀ gẅiin, tá mbà pi ka kě ńkúʼte shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, tà pi te wɔ́ɔn moŋe. À yɛ̂ mbà n tsɔ̌ʼ ncwò ndá ńná né pi. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à piŋ ńkuʼu léjÿɔ́ʼ, à te wó wɔ́.
en: I know your works. Look, I have placed before you an open door that no one can close because you have but little power; yet you have kept my word and have not denied my name.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo sẅiŋ pʉ̀a pe cúʼtè ye Sátà, á mbwó pi, é megàŋ cÿɔ̌nò pie é gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ée pà Yúndà, tá ńké ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ ncwò ńgɔɔn. N ge tsóte wɔ́b, pɔ́ tó Ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò pi, ńzẅíŋ ngie n kwoŋo gẅí.
en: Note this: I will make those from the synagogue of Satan, who claim to be Jews and are not, but are lying #— #I will make them come and bow down at your feet,    and they will know that I have loved you.   # 3:9 Is 43:4

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ka kúʼte shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn tà pi te kʉ́a la, mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n ge gÿo tÿɔ́ʼte gẅí na fʉ̀ʼ gie ngɔ́ʼ ge gÿo tóo tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó ntsèm, é lʉŋte pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: Because you have kept my command to endure, I will also keep you from the hour of testing    that is going to come on the whole world to test those who live on the earth.   # 3:10 Rv 6:10; 8:13; 11:10; 13:8,14; 17:8

ngiemboon: N ge tɔ́g tó. Pi kúʼte mmó gie áa mbwó pi tà à tʉ, ńzsé ngie atsɔ̌ nyìŋ te kẅé gi ngǔʼ wɔ́.
en: I am coming soon.    Hold on to what you have,   # 3:11 Rv 2:25 so that no one takes your crown.   # 3:11 1Co 9:25; 1Th 2:19; 2Tm 4:8; Jms 1:12; 1Pt 5:4

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lÿɔ́ʼ ncù tà cʉa nò tepòŋ, N ge gÿo lɔgɔ ngàŋ é tÿɔ́g ntóon na jʉʼʉ ssé yɔɔn, angàŋ le láʼ éfó jʉʼó, ńgʉa tsɔ́ jʉʼ wɔ́. N ge gÿo ŋweʼe lezíŋ Ssé yɔ̀ɔn á na ngàŋ, é gíŋ ŋweʼe lezíŋ tÿǒsoŋ ye Ssé yɔ̀ɔn na ngàŋ. Ayɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ gwɔ́ Yelúzálèm yesẅé gie á fóo tÿǒ lepwó, á lejʉ́ŋ Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, ésẅɛ́ʼɛ. N ge gíŋ ŋweʼe mbɔɔ lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn se sẅé á na ngàŋ.
en: “The one who conquers I will make a pillar    in the temple of my God, and he will never go out again. I will write on him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God #— #the new Jerusalem,   # 3:12 Ezk 48:35; Gl 4:26; Heb 12:22; Rv 21:2 which comes down out of heaven from my God #— #and my new name.   # 3:12 Rv 2:17; 7:3; 14:1; 22:4

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjúʼu nò, á júʼu nò gie Zẅìge Ssé ne ńgɔɔn mbwó mecúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto lɔɔn!»
en: “Let anyone who has ears to hear listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.

ngiemboon: «Ŋweʼe menò mɔɔn, ńtúm ńnáa mbwó cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à líe cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto gie áa tÿǒsoŋo Lawondísè. Ŋweʼe ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie lezíŋ sé ée lê Amɛn, á gwɔ́ njÿòngyá we te kubé shwóŋè, á gẅie à gɔɔn nò gie áa nénʉ́, á gẅie yé zɔɔ nzyeté na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Ssé la nyɛte, à ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: “Write to the angel of the church in Laodicea: Thus says the Amen,    the faithful and true witness, the originator   # 3:14 Or beginning, or ruler,# 3:14 Mk 10:6; 13:19; Jn 1:1–5; Col 1:18; 2Pt 3:4 of God’s creation:

ngiemboon: N ne ńzsé mefàʼ mí. Pi te sẅé, ńké te tween. Pi gɔ̌ɔn ngie pi ge fó sẅé sẅé à gaa, éfó tween tween à gaa.
en: I know your works, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish that you were cold or hot.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ne ḿbÿɛ́ɛ pÿɛ̌ páʼ ntse gẅie mé zẅɛ́ʼte zẅɛ́ʼte la, ńké te sẅé, ńké te tween la, pi ge fó ncwò mèŋ kẅɛ páʼ zèʼe la.
en: So, because you are lukewarm, and neither hot nor cold, I am going to vomit    you out of my mouth.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ne ńgɔɔn ngie: “Pi ee ngàŋa mmó, ngie pi kéen ńgẅiin nkáb tà é gyɔ́ɔn, tà pi cʉʼʉ́ ńzága tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́ la,” páʼ pi ké te ne ńzsé ngie pi ee ngàŋngɔ́ʼ tà ngwɔ́ mé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mí tsɔ̌ɔn wɔ́ la, mbɔɔ páʼ pi te ne ńzsé ngie pi ee mefÿɔg, ńgwɔ́ pà fʉ̀menÿɔ́g, ńtyéte té jÿɔ́g nzsǒ wɔ́ la,
en: For you say, ‘I’m rich; I have become wealthy and need nothing,’    and you don’t realize that you are wretched, pitiful, poor, blind, and naked.

ngiemboon: n ge ké shwóŋo gẅí ngie pi tóo mbwó mèŋ, ńjúu tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie mé kéen ńdɔg mmɔ̌g ńkẅile ncÿǒ mǒ ntsèm, ńdeen ńké ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó fʉʼó, ńgíŋ ńjú mefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ mbwó mèŋ, ńzsé ngie pi ge gẅiin nzsǒ gie pi ge maʼ, eshʉ́ le gíŋ ńkúu gẅí ńtí páʼ pi tyeté té jÿɔ́g nzsǒ wɔ́. Pi ge gíŋ júu ffo menÿɔ́g mbwó mèŋ, é néŋe na menÿɔ́g mí, légwɔ́ gie pi ge gyá jʉʼ.
en: I advise you to buy from me gold refined in the fire so that you may be rich,    white clothes so that you may be dressed and your shameful nakedness not be exposed,   # 3:18 Gn 2:25; Is 20:4; Ezk 23:29; Rv 16:15 and ointment to spread on your eyes so that you may see.

ngiemboon: N gʉa na pʉ̀a pie n kwoŋo wɔ́b, ńkaga wɔ́b metsèm, ńcúɔ mbɔɔ cǔa. Púʼu la, pi zeŋe nnɛ́ éfaʼa fàʼ, ḿbiŋ ńkúbe mà gẅi.
en: As many as I love, I rebuke and discipline.    So be zealous and repent.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ wɔɔn, mbà n tǒ ńtyé, ńne ńkwáʼte ncwò ndá, ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńjúʼ ngyè yɔ̀ɔn, ńtsɔ́ʼ ncwò ndá, mbà n ge kúu ndá ngàŋ, é néŋe ssé, peg ngàŋ pfɛ́ɛ mmó, angàŋ piŋ ńnéŋe ssé peg yé pfɛ́ɛ mmó.
en: See! I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in to him and eat with him, and he with me.

ngiemboon: Á ge gÿo gʉa na nyìŋ gẅie à lÿɔ̌ʼ ncù tà ńcʉa nò tepòŋ, n zẅíŋ à néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ á ngʉ̀ŋe yɔ́ɔn, páʼ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n da lÿɔ́ʼ ncù tà ńcʉa nò tepòŋ, Tá wɔ̀ɔn zẅíŋ n néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ á ngʉ̀ŋe yé la.
en: “To the one who conquers I will give the right to sit with me on my throne,    just as I also conquered and sat down with my Father on his throne.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó, lélɔg ńjúʼu nò, á júʼu nò gie Zẅìge Ssé ne ńgɔɔn mbwó mecúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto lɔɔn.»
en: “Let anyone who has ears to hear listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.”
